availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jackson R. Mullins (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Sutton Mullins in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on February 20, 1847. Father of Josiah Mullins and Micajah Mullins. Farmer in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1850. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 166B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, p. 204A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, District 6, p. 93B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pulaski County Marriages, Film 000804052.
